body.name: Dream On Me Austin Toddler Day Bed in Pebble Grey, Greenguard Gold Certified

features: IDEAL TRANSITION BED: The Austin Toddler Day Bed features a convenient, low-to-floor- design, making it easy for your child to get in and out of bed. A removable side safety guard rail prevents any accidental falls while sleeping

SMART DESIGN: The Austin features modish styling with a beautifully curved headboard. A mix of curved and straight lines makes it an ideal choice for the modern-day parent. It is made of durable pinewood. Let your child pick from five stylish non-toxic finishes

ALWAYS SAFE: The Austin is JPMA certified and meets/exceeds all applicable ASTM/CPSC standards. Recommended for children 18 months to 5 years old or up to 50 pounds. Only eco-friendly, child-safe water-based paints used

MATTRESS MATTERS: The Austin comes with a wooden mattress support rails so there is no need for a box spring. Choose any Dream On Me non-toxic, Greenguard certified standard crib mattress for a perfect fit
PRODUCT SPECS: The Austin is built of durable, sustainable and renewable New Zealand pine wood. Dimensions are 54 L x 30 W x 29 H inches. All tools for assembly included
body.description: "The Austin Toddler Day Bed is the ideal transition bed for when your child is too big for a crib but too small for a full-size bed. It features a convenient low-to-floor design, making it easy for your child to get in and out of bed. A removable side safety guard rail is what you need to prevent any accidental falls for the restless sleeper! The Austin’s design is stylish and practical. It features a handsomely carved headboard with a mix of curved and straight lines that allow it to blend in with a variety of decors. Let your child pick from five stylish safe, non-toxic, water-based finishes! It is built of durable, renewable, sustainable New Zealand pinewood, making it a lasting buy! The Austin comes with a wooden mattress support so there is no need for a box spring. Choose any Dream On Me non-toxic, Greenguard certified standard crib mattress for a perfect fit. The Austin is JPMA certified and meets/exceeds all applicable ASTM and CPSC standards. All tools needed for assembly are included. Recommended for children 18 months to 5 years old or up to 50 lbs. Product specs are: 54 L x 29.8 W x 28.8 H inches".

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Came perfectly packed, no scratches or anything like that. It was really easy to assemble it. I am a woman and did it myself in 15-20 minutes while cooking dinner and with 20 mo toddler “helping” me😅 The bed looks better than I expected. It’s sturdy and just great. My lo likes it a lot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble
reviews.reviewText: Very nice looking. Sturdy. Easy to assemble. Perfect toddler bed. My 2yr old grandson loves it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy & well made.
reviews.reviewText: Very nice! A great value. Pretty, sturdy & well made.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great and looks phenomenal
reviews.reviewText: This is a very nice looking toddler bed. My only complaint is that I wish the boards were a little sturdier. I leaned on the bed to rub my daughters back as she fell asleep and cracked one of the boards. I barely put weight on it as I was sitting on the floor. So don't do that and you'll be fine lol. She initially fell out of this bed twice and then maybe 2 more times in the few months that we had it. So we made sure to put pillows down near the entrance. She very much enjoys this bed though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for a growing toddler.
reviews.reviewText: My nephew was visiting with his 2-year old, who was still a little young to be sleeping outside a crib. But I wanted a bed that could “grow” with the 2-year old when he comes to visit a year from now, so I did not want a crib. But I also did not want an open toddler bed that he could roll out of before he is ready. The bed, with an opening on just one side, was perfect. This year, when he is 2, I could just put the open side next to the wall, so it was like having a crib (no openings). The next year when they return, I can just turn the crib around and have the opening on the outside, letting him crawl out after he wakes up.It worked super well this year for him as a 2-year old. Looking forward to turning the bed around for the “big boy” that he will be next year when he turns 3. 🤗

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bed at Grandma house
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for those occasional sleepovers. Not big and bulk and fits well in smaller room

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My little girl loves it
reviews.reviewText: Assembly was super easy and straightforward. The most complex part was keeping the wood pieces at the bottom together when doing final assembly. Daughter went straight to it and immediately was in love with it. Fits her nicely and is light enough to be easily maneuvered and repositioned throughout the room. There’s enough room under to allow for good airflow and convenient cat storage.
